CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1946, p. 8,  reads: "United in Marriage - In a traditionally simple home marriage ceremony, performed Nov. 27, Miss Doris Nunn, niece of Mr. and Mrs. William G. Nunn, said "I do" to Malcolm Haines, son of Mr. and Mrs. William C. Price of New York, at the home of the bride. Given in marriage by Mr. Nunn, the bride wore a white bridal gown with a veil of illusion.  Miss Hattie Powell was maid of honor, shown to the right of the bride, and Clifton Brown, left of the groom, was best man.  The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Porter W. Phillips.  Brew Jackson was soloist."
TitMainTitle: Groom Malcolm Haines, and bride Doris Nunn wearing gown with sweetheart neckline and tulle overlay, standing in front of palms
